articles.description:

articles.description:
Google has released its monthly security updates for the Android operating system to address a known security flaw that it said has come under active exploitation in the wild.
The high-severity vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-32896 (CVSS score: 7.8), relates to a case of privilege escalation in the Android Framework component.

articles.title: Google Confirms CVE-2024-32896 Exploited in the Wild, Releases Android Security Patch

articles.description:

articles.title: Hackers Hijack 22,000 Removed PyPI Packages, Spreading Malicious Code to Developers

articles.description:

articles.title: Zyxel Patches Critical OS Command Injection Flaw in Access Points and Routers

articles.title: Hacktivists Exploits WinRAR Vulnerability in Attacks Against Russia and Belarus

articles.title: New Rust-Based Ransomware Cicada3301 Targets Windows and Linux Systems

articles.title: Rocinante Trojan Poses as Banking Apps to Steal Sensitive Data from Brazilian Android Users

articles.description:
